paces and speeds but from what we've seen organizations really go through kind of four phases when we look at
cloud adoption so that first phase is what we kind of call discovery testing this is where they get their foot in
their water they might try out like a dev test work load a new application that's not mission-critical
and and the reason why they start here is it's where they really kind of are able to prove out the value right now
once they've done that they quickly move into phase 2 which is this application based project phase and so this is where
we see a lot of organizations start to move over their websites ecommerce tax we actually see a heavy influx here of
analytical workloads just because it's so cheap to put data in the cloud and then run those queries that used to
take tons of processing time they can use the elastic nature of cloud and then spin that back down and so they'll start
to get the value here and then they move to what we call kind of a cloud first or standardization effort right and this is
where they start to take a look at their back office applications and these are those mission-critical applications that
need to stay up so there's now new SLA is that they have to take a look at and when they're at this phase this is when
